intro: Psychotria vichadensis, commonly known as the Vichada Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest regions of Colombia and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
